title: Print Log - track prints with photos and notes
description:
Kids should be able to:
- Log their prints with photos
- Rate how the print turned out
- Note problems and how they fixed them
- Build a portfolio of their work
- Share progress (safely, with parent approval)

Store in localStorage for privacy.

title: Build out learning modules beyond basics.html
description:

comments.author: Will F
comments.text: Starting with this module first - it's the foundation for everything else

comments.author: Will F
comments.text:
VISION: Find great 3D printing courses to build our learning modules with interactive lessons.

Key approach:
- Kids BUILD something every week (not just theory)
- From those builds, they PUT UP ITEMS TO SELL
- They SHARE build directions on GitHub for others
- Learning loop: Build → Sell → Share → Create more

This creates a virtuous cycle:
1. Learn by doing (weekly builds)
2. Entrepreneurship (selling what they make)
3. Open source contribution (sharing on GitHub)
4. Community building (helping others learn)

Research needed: Find existing 3D printing curricula and courses we can adapt/reference for age-appropriate weekly projects.

comments.author: Will F
comments.text:
RESEARCH FINDINGS - Top 3D Printing Curricula:

1. PrintLab (weareprintlab.com) - BEST MATCH
   - Projects 5-7 include entrepreneurship + iterative design
   - 30+ Tinkercad & Fusion 360 projects
   - Human-centered design challenges

2. NextWaveSTEM - 15-lesson sequence
   - Culminates in student-run 'souvenir shop'
   - Branding, iteration, production planning

3. Kids Can CAD Academy - Weekly video lessons
   - Design-thinking challenges
   - Team collaboration projects

4. STEM in the Middle - Free lesson plans
   - steminthemiddle.net/3d-printing-posts/

5. MyStemKits - Ready-to-print + lesson plans

WEEKLY STRUCTURE FOR LAYERBEE:
Week 1-2: First print (benchy) → Document setup on GitHub
Week 3-4: Keychain/name tag → List to sell → Share STL
Week 5-6: Phone stand → Price & sell → Fork-friendly repo
Week 7-8: Custom organizer → Product photos → Tutorial
Week 9-10: Design for others → Commission work → Open source

Starting build now!

title: Add gamification and achievements for kids
description:
Make learning addictive (in a good way):
- Badges for completing modules
- Print streak tracking
- Problem-solving achievements
- Business milestones
- Visual progress celebration

Kids should WANT to come back and learn more.

title: Enhance AI tutor with visual problem diagnosis
description:
Make LayerBEE smarter:
- Accept photo uploads of print problems
- Visual diagnosis with image analysis
- Step-by-step troubleshooting guides
- Quiz mode with instant feedback
- Personalized learning path based on progress

WebLLM already handles text, need to add image capabilities.
